Key Arguments: The legislation seeks to diminish and potentially remove free speech.
Existing laws already address hate speech and incitement to violence, making further legislation unnecessary.
Government information is often unreliable, citing examples like COVID-19, climate change, and 'the voice'.
The government is not afraid of misinformation but of people speaking the truth.
Comparisons are made to North Korea, suggesting that such limitations on free speech would lead to a poorer society.
Notable Quotes: Quite simply the people who drafted this bill and those who supported it should be ashamed that they seek to diminish and potentially remove any and all free speech from the public domain.
The government is not afraid of misinformation, they are afraid people will speak the truth.
The attempts to inflict limitations on free speech as seen in places like North Korea can only lead to a poorer Australian society.
